pros: Great team, to learn and grow with. Principal is great. Benefits are good.

cons: Poor management Company seems to care more about the money then the treatment the clients receive, or how the employees are treated

pros: The job flexibility of the position.

review_title: It's good, if you work hard at it.

pros: Raises come often, schedule is rotating so you get days off during the week, co-workers are helpful and always have your back.
cons: Long hours and often times go over your shift and it is out of your control. Too many weekends. Salary does not match the amount of work you are given.

pros: My coworkers and supervisors are great to work with. The organization provides great PTO and benefits.
cons: Very spread out across the state with limited communication throughout regarding the direction of the company.

pros: Some positives include a set schedule, paid training, always OT available, open during COVID-19, good compensation, various career paths available, networking
cons: The cons include an often chaotic day-to-day routine, forced OT, utilizing physically demanding restrictive procedures, turnover, and medication administration responsibilities

review_title: Quit within 30 days or get fired by 90
pros: If you want the overtime, it’s there.
cons: The works that you do here is literally just getting beat up by kids daily with ABSOLUTELY no support from assistant director not director

review_title: Not a good place to work

cons: No one has your back. If you confront a client, you get in trouble.

pros: Having a paycheck  versus $0
cons: Horrible pay rate. Horrible  working conditions where verbal abuse is common toward the youth by overworked,  underpaid  staff. Extremely long weekend hours 3 weekends a month if you work night shift.

pros: Opportunities to advance, learning experiences.
cons: Lack of leadership from supervisors and upper management

review_title: Good place to gain case management skills
pros: Great PTO, mileage reimbursement, paid for on call time.  Great co-workers that work hard and support each other.
cons: Insane amount of paperwork, it sometimes feels as if that is more important than providing therapy to families. NO work life balance- therapists are always working- so much documentation, reports, etc.  It never ends.  If a family cancels a session and the therapist can't get the family to reschedule another weekday, the expectation is that the therapist will  schedule sessions on weekends, even if it is a holiday weekend.  In order to do this job, a therapist has to have excellent time management skills.

job_title: C1, C2, Caseworker II in Latrobe, PA
pros: Pto is good. Ability to move up from c1 to c2 easily. And another reviewer said it right: clocking out at the end of the day!
cons: CONSTANT paperwork (not worth the pay to do that and supervise kids). The management is all out for themselves. Jobs like this should have a union because any mistakes or issues just pile up and then you're surprised with a reprimand! Also, a very good supervisor was let go recently over a water pitcher being placed over a smoke alarm while he was on pto!!!! It's unreal how they can find reasons to fire someone like that over the slightest thing.

review_title: Think twice unless it is for first time employment
pros: You will meet a very diverse clientele base to provide you with experience for your professional career
cons: Lack of support and respect from leadership team.

job_title: Mental Health Therapist in Greensburg, PA
pros: I was able to really bond with my clients in the unit. I went to court regularly and spoke with probation officers and judges about what was needed for the child in order to successful. I was apart of training new employees. My bosses respected me as a clinician and never indemnified me.
cons: Being in a locked facility all day could be hard especially not being able to communicate with your spouse or loved ones when something happens .

review_title: I love my job and I love working for Adelphoi!
job_title: School Based Mental Health Therapist in Latrobe, PA
pros: Administration and coworkers are supportive and have the kids' best interest in mind .
cons: There are no cons; I am 49 years old and have worked at a lot places throughout my life and Adelphoi is by far the most satisfied I have ever been in a job; I absolutely love coming to work!

review_title: A Mission that has gone astray
pros: Good place to get initial trainings and experience.  Ability to interact with managers and staff.
cons: The current leadership focuses only on the bottom line.  The Mission of Adelphoi Village has been forgotten.   They financially award those that don't ask questions while the staff that deal with the difficult clients are viewed as collateral damage.  Benefits continue to be cut.

pros: Lots of trainings. You will practice evidence based treatments. You are treated like a respected clinician. Great benefits. Flexible schedule. Strength focused view of clinician. Very satisfying when families are successful.
cons: Driving, meeting families around their schedule can hinder work/life balance. Lots of documentation.  Can be hard on families with young children. Often families resist treatment if it is court ordered.

pros: Great company to work for. Caseworkers and supervisor Chris Gresko  are good people to work with.
cons: Only the fact that if there is anything going on it is in the Greensburg and areas surrounding, and we cannot get to because of distance. We are in the Huntingdon County area. That is the only con I can think of.

review_title: Adelphoi Village is a good company for those who are just starting a career.
pros: Adelphoi Village has an ok benefit package.
cons: Adelphoi Village used to really care about the employee and the employees family, over the years they are moving away from that and you are just another number. As an enviroment that is hard and stressful I feel it is a shame they are getting away from this.

review_title: Excellent place to work but the management was "cliquey"
pros: You get a chance to do very important work with teens. You make lasting friendships with other employees, education is very good.
cons: The management staff were all good friends and this at times interfered with their being attuned to the needs of the staff.

pros: Rewarding to work with youth.
cons: All management lies. They cover everything up to make themselves look better and keep their jobs. They need to get rid of the President that has placed all his friends and family in management jobs.

job_title: Youth Care Worker II in Duncansville, PA
pros: Making a difference in youth's lives, the co-workers and the supervisors, good benefits, overtime if you want it.
cons: None. Overall, it was a great job.

review_title: Overall a great place to work
pros: Hours are good. Rotating schedule means you aren't restricted in your personal life. pay is decent to start. Management works with you if you have conflicts in schedule. Overall a great environment with sociable co-workers.
cons: Nothing bad to say so far.

pros: In general, the people are good to work with. You will learn responsibility and routine.
cons: Unfortunately, very little education and no experience is required, and one bad apple spoils the bunch.

pros: Independence, the company trusts you with much responsibility, opportunity for overtime, good staff
cons: Pay, hours, amount of responsibility, chances of being investigated by DPW are high
